Latex Cheatsheet for Paper Writers (last updated on 2015-03-15)

09 Feb 2015

Here are some tips for writing papers and it is constantly updated.

Customizing Enumerated Lists

Very often, you would want to change the counters for enumerate environment in latex. One way to achieve this is to use enumitem package.

However, if you are using the IEEE template with \documentclass[]{IEEEtran} , you might well faw an error Command \labelindent already defined. This is because both the IEEEclass.cls document class and the enumitem.sty package define the macro \labelindent . Therefore, before including the enumitem package, you can disable the \labelindent using: 

\let\labelindent\relax
\usepackage{enumeitem}

After successfully including the enumitem, you can customize your enumeration counter using the following code 

\begin{enumerate}[label=Type-\arabic*:]
\item Item 1
\item Item 2
\item Item 3
\end{enumerate}

Here, the counter is "Type-1", "Type-2",...

Besides \arabic*, it also supports a series of starred versions of \alph, \Alph, \roman, \Roman as counters for the current level enumeration.

By default, align=right, which means that if you are setting a very long counter including texts, it can be out of the range of text. In terms of final appearances, align=left is recommended, since it leave some space at the beginning for a neater listing. However, this may not be of your desire when you are writing a paper that is currently marginally passing the page limit. To save space, while not violating the page margin, you can use 

leftmargin=*
If you are still not happy with the result, you can customize the leftmargin yourself using 
leftmargin=2cm
